alert.note: Alert for Alcorn; Benton; DeSoto; Marshall; Tate; Tippah; Tishomingo; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 11:14PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of North Mississippi and West Tennessee, including the following counties, in North Mississippi, Alcorn, Benton, DeSoto, Marshall, Tate, Tippah, Tishomingo and Tunica. In West Tennessee, Fayette, Hardeman, Hardin and McNairy. * WHEN...Until 215 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1114 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Collierville, Corinth, Hernando, Senatobia, Holly Springs, Savannah, Selmer, Big Hill Pond State Park, Pickwick Landing State Park, Lamar, Adamsville, Coldwater, Byhalia, Tunica, Snow Lake Shores, Canaan, Michigan City, Lagrange, Slayden and Mt Pleasant. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Alcorn; Benton; DeSoto; Marshall; Tate; Tippah; Tishomingo; Tunica
